name: Mediterranean Information Office for Environment, Culture and Sustainable Development
legal: independent legal entity, civil, non-profit organisation
goal: The Mediterranean Information Office for Environment, Culture and Sustainable Development, is a non-profit Federation of Mediterranean Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs) for Environment and Development. MIO-ECSDE acts as a technical and political platform for the presentation of views and intervention of NGOs in the Euro-Mediterranean scene. In co-operation with governments, international organisations and other socio-economic partners, MIO-ECSDE plays an active role for the protection of the environment and the promotion of the sustainable development of the Mediterranean region and its countries. The Federation’s Secretariat is based in Athens, in the old and historic district of Plaka. Its main objectives are to protect the Natural Environment (flora and fauna, biotopes, forests, coasts, natural resources, climate) and the Cultural Heritage (animate and inanimate) of the Mediterranean region. The ultimate goal of MIO-ECSDE is to promote Sustainable Development in a peaceful Mediterranean. The Federation consists of 128 Full and Corresponding Members who share the same benefits and rights, except for the right to vote at the Annual General Meeting (AGM), which is reserved only for Full Members. MIO-ECSDE is headed by an Executive Bureau, which consists of eighteen (18) Members. Eight members are from the EU Mediterranean countries, seven are from the non-EU Mediterranean countries, and three are ex officio members representing the founders, the European Environment Bureau, Elliniki Etairia and the Arab Network for Environment and Development (RAED). The Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Member Organisations remains the main institution constituting the basis of the Federation. The AGM is convened once a year. The Chairman, with the support of the Secretariat is first and foremost responsible for ensuring the feasibility of implementing the work programme within the available resources. The Chairman and the Treasurer at a first step and the Executive Bureau and Annual General Meeting at a next one, supervise all expenditures. The Executive Bureau is regularly informed and controls the finances.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Culture, Education and training, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Youth
euInitiatives:
MIO-ECSDE is following the General Union Environment Action Programme to 2020 (7thEAP) 'Living well, within the limits of our planet'.
Emphasis is given to work under:
- the Habitats and Birds Directives & EU Biodiversity Strategy to 2020;
- the Marine Strategy Framework Directive & the EC Ocean Governance Actions;
- the Roadmap for resource efficiency;
- the Circular Economy Package including the Strategy on Plastics and the Single-Use Plastics Directive;
- the European Neighborhood Policy and the Regional Southern Mediterranean Strategy.

Position Papers and Consultations

Public Consultation on the Evaluation of the 7th Environment Action Programme (7th EAP). The consultation ran from 3 May - 26 July 2018, https://bit.ly/2UsuMma

Stakeholders consultation carried out by the MERCES (Marine Ecosystem Restoration in Changing European Seas) project, an EU-funded Research and Innovation project dedicated to the development and promotion of marine restoration. The survey ran in March 2018

Public consultation on reducing marine litter: actions on single use plastics and fishing gear. The consultation ran from mid-December 2017 till mid-February 2018 and aimed to provide input, opinions and data for the preparation of a follow-up to the Plastics Strategy in relation to marine litter, particularly on single-use plastics and fishing gear, https://bit.ly/2BtyLpM.

European Seas Environmental Cooperation - Two years to make EU seas healthy again, April 2018, https://bit.ly/2CeLMFq

OurBlueLung, December 2018, Thomais Vlachogianni, https://bit.ly/2O5dgSM

Regional Networks on Education for Sustainable Development, April 2018, https://bit.ly/2FUcIw3

Position Paper on the Future of Education for Sustainable Development, January 2019

The future of the MSFD - joint NGO letter to the Marine Directors, May 2019

MSFD Common Implementation Strategy Questionnaire, April 2019, https://ec.europa.eu/eusurvey/runner/MSFD-CIS-Art20

Evaluation of EMODnet - Open Stakeholder Consultation, April 2019, https://ec.europa.eu/eusurvey/runner/emodnet_evaluation?surveylanguage=en

Implementation and compliance with EU environmental laws in the Member States - survey April 2019, https://ec.europa.eu/eusurvey/printcontribution?code=af09d5a1-6284-435b-9dfb-1a6fdd5318d1

Online consultation for the draft COP 21 Ministerial Declaration, June 2019
